page.title: 03Somerset Village
page.content: Alhampton is a small village in Somerset.There are 65 houses,there has been 3 houses,9 bungalows and 4 council houses built recently.There used to be a bakery,but it has been converted into a house(Bakewell House).There are more holiday homes than residential houses,because house prices are very high.The only milking cows in Alhampton now are two Jerseys at Langford Farm for personal use.There is a small caravan site behind the Inn,during the summer there are an average of 7 caravans on the site.There is a little tin church,it is quite small.There is a house called Saftey Light House , it was called this because they say that it had almost been burnt down but it wouldnt burn.So it was re_built
